outcome: /JUDGMENT IN CC 1914/2016 OF JMFC, KALAMASSERY (TEMPORARY) CRIME NO.735/2016 OF Eloor Police Station , Ernakulam PETITIONER/ACCUSED: JAYAKUMAR E.A AGED 51 YEARS, S/O AYYAPPAN PILLAI, EDIYODETH, PUTHAN
full_text: Pea Sue Bae IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM 2020/KER/950 PRESENT THE HONOURABLE MR. JUSTICE P.B.SURESH KUMAR THURSDAY, THE O9TH DAY OF JANUARY 2020 / 19TH POUSHA, 1941 Crl1.MC.No.2858 OF 2017 AGAINST THE ORDER/JUDGMENT IN CC 1914/2016 OF JMFC, KALAMASSERY (TEMPORARY) CRIME NO.735/2016 OF Eloor Police Station , Ernakulam PETITIONER/ACCUSED: JAYAKUMAR E.A AGED 51 YEARS, S/O AYYAPPAN PILLAI, EDIYODETH, PUTHANPURAKKAL VEETTIL, ELOOR, ERNAKULAM DIST. BY ADVS. SRI.B.RAMAN PILLAI (SR.) SRI.R.ANIL SRI.T.ANIL KUMAR SRI .M. SUNILKRUMAR SRI.SUJESH MENON V.B. SRI.THOMAS ABRAHAM (NILACKAPPILLIL) SRI.THOMAS SABU VADAKERKUT SMT.S.LAKSHMI SANKAR RESPONDENTS/STATE & COMPLAINANTS/ CW1: 1 STATE OF KERALA, REP. BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA, ERNAKULAM-682 031 2 SUB INSPECTOR OF POLICE, ELOOR POLICE STATION, ELOOR, KOCHI CITY- 683 501 3 GEETHA GEORGE, AGED 50 YEARS, W/O GEORGE, THOTTIPPARAMBIL, MANJUMMAL, ELOOR, ERNAKULAM DIST- 683 501 R1 & R2 BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR SRI.SANTHOSH PETER R3 BY ADV. SRI.SHERRY J. THOMAS BY ADV. SRI.M.SUNILKUMAR THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING BEEN FINALLY HEARD ON 09.01.2020, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: nee Cr1.M.C.No.2858 of 2017 2 2020/KER/950 Cri.M.C. No.2858 of 2017 Dated 9* January, 2020. ORDER This is a proceedings under Section 482 of the Code of Criminal Procedure for quashing Annexure - A2 Final Report pending trial before the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court, Kalamassery in C.C.No.1914 of 2016. 2. The petitioner is the accused _ in the said case. The case was one registered under Sections 406 and 420 read with Section 34 of the Indian Penal Code. 3. It is seen that the petitioner and the de facto complainant have amicably settled the disputes. An_ affidavit sworn to by the de facto complainant to that effect is part of the records. 4. Heard the learned counsel for the _ petitioner, the learned Public Prosecutor as also the learned counsel for the de facto complainant. nee Cr1.M.C.No.2858 of 2017 3 2020/KER/950 5. In the light of the decision of the Apex Court in Gian singh v. State of Punjab, (2012) 10 SCC 303, insofar as the offences alleged against the petitioner are only offences punishable under Sections 406 and 420 read with Section 34 of the Indian Penal Code, | am of the view that this is an appropriate case where this court has to invoke the jurisdiction under Section 482 of the Code of Criminal Procedure to quash the proceedings. In the result, the Crl.M.C. is allowed and Annexure - A2 Final Report pending before the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court, Kalamassery in C.C.No.1914 of 2016 is quashed. Sd/- P.B.SURESH KUMAR, JUDGE. tgs oe 7 seein Baa Cr1.M.C.No.2858 of 2017 4 2020/KER/950 APPENDIX PETITIONER'S/S EXHIBITS: ANNEXURE Al CERTIFIED COPY OF FIR AND FIRST INFORMATION STATEMENT IN CRIME NO.735/16 OF ELOOR POLICE STATION ANNEXURE A2 CERTIFIED COPY OF THE FINAL REPORT IN CRIME NO.735/16 OF ELOOR POLICE STATION PENDING AS CC NO.1914/16 ON THE FILES OF JFCM COURT, KALAMASSERY ANNEXURE A3 AN AFFIDAVIT DATED 8.1.2020 SWORN BY THE THIRD RESPONDENT RESPONDENT/S EXHIBITS: NIL //TRUE COPY// P.S. to Judge
